sense.name: attest to the truth of a proposition, corroborate with evidence
sense.commentary: Syntax Is: NP1[topic] CONFIRM NP2 NP1[instrument] CONFIRM NP2
sense.examples: "The evidence confirms the defendant's story." "Similar findings have been confirmed in recent clinical experiments." "The smoke confirmed what he had expected: there had been a party in his absence!" "The witness confirmed the victim's account."

sense.name: make a situation definite or official
sense.commentary: Syntax Includes: NP1[agent] CONFIRM NP2[state] NP1[actor] CONFIRM NP2[state] NP1[cause] CONFIRM NP2[state]
sense.examples: "Working on the campaign confirmed her desire to go into politics." "Call the travel agency to confirm your reservation." "I have accepted the job over the phone, but I haven't confirmed it in writing."

sense.name: legally approve or ratify a person for a position
sense.commentary: Note: This is a narrow, restricted sense from sense 2, relating to political ratification.
sense.examples: "The Senate confirmed the President's candiate for Secretary of Defense." "They confirmed his appointment to the post with a unanimous vote."

sense.name: administer the rite of religious confirmation
sense.examples: "The children were confirmed in their mother's faith." "The elders confirmed the newcomer as a full member of the church."
